SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.modelView

Class ModelView

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.modelView.ModelView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ModelView extends Object implements Serializable
The ModelView class represents a set of immutable objects that are sent to the client. It provides a snapshot of the game state that can be used for rendering and displaying information to the players.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ModelView

      public ModelView(int numPlayers, GameRules gameRules)
      Constructs a ModelView object.
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - The number of players in the associated game.
      gameRules - Used to read the game rules from a JSON file. It provides the rules and settings for the game.

    • ModelView

      public ModelView()
      Constructs a new instance of the ModelView class. This constructor creates a ModelView object without any parameters.

  • Method Details

    • getIntegerValue

      public int getIntegerValue(String nickname)
      Gets the index of a player based on their nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player.
      Returns:
      The index of the player. Returns -1 if the player is not found.

    • winnerEndGame

      public void winnerEndGame()
      Sorts the player points and personal points to determine the winner at the end of the game.

    • setNextPlayer

      public void setNextPlayer()
      Sets the turn to the next active player in the game. If the current player is the last active player, the turn is set to the first active player.

    • findPreviousPlayer

      public PlayerPointsView findPreviousPlayer()
      Finds the previous active player in the game.
      Returns:
      The PlayerPointsView object representing the previous active player.

    • getBookshelfView

      public ItemTileView[][] getBookshelfView(String nickname)
      Retrieves the bookshelf view for a specific player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player.
      Returns:
      The bookshelf view for the player.

    • setBookshelfView

      public void setBookshelfView(ItemTileView[][] bookshelfView, String nickname)
      Sets the bookshelf view for a specific player.
      Parameters:
      bookshelfView - The bookshelf view to set.
      nickname - The nickname of the player.

    • getBookshelfView

      public ItemTileView[][][] getBookshelfView()
      Retrieves the bookshelf view.
      Returns:
      The bookshelf view represented as a three-dimensional array of ItemTileView objects. The first dimension represents the player index, the second dimension represents the rows of the bookshelf, and the third dimension represents the columns of the bookshelf.

    • setBookshelfView

      public void setBookshelfView(ItemTileView[][][] bookshelfView)
      Sets the bookshelf view.
      Parameters:
      bookshelfView - The new bookshelf view to be set.

    • getPlayerPoints

      public PlayerPointsView[] getPlayerPoints()
      Retrieves the player points for all players.
      Returns:
      An array of PlayerPointsView objects representing the player points.

    • setPlayerPoints

      public void setPlayerPoints(PlayerPointsView playerPoints, int index)
      Sets the player points for a specific player.
      Parameters:
      playerPoints - The PlayerPointsView object representing the player points.
      index - The index of the player.

    • setPlayerPoints

      public void setPlayerPoints(PlayerPointsView[] playerPoints)
      Sets the player points views for all players.
      Parameters:
      playerPoints - An array of PlayerPointsView objects representing the points views for each player. The index of each element in the array corresponds to the player index.
